sentences.en: Alexandra felt that this was a tactful speech.
sentences.cn: 亚历山德拉觉得这番话讲得颇有风趣.

sentences.en: And he was seldom tactful in doing it.
sentences.cn: 何况他这样做拐弯抹角的.

sentences.en: He was deeper, more reserved, and more tactful.
sentences.cn: 他城府深沉, 比较机灵.

sentences.en: His criticism was couched in very tactful language.
Hurstwood, still tactful in distress, added nothing to this.
sentences.cn: 赫斯渥贫困中仍不失老练, 听了这话就不再说什么了.

sentences.en: I decided it wouldn't be tactful to order another beer.
sentences.cn: 我想了想，觉得再要啤酒就有点过分了。

sentences.en: I made a tactful retreat before they started arguing.
sentences.cn: 在他们开始争论前我机智地离开了.

sentences.en: I shall never forget the tactful patience with which he persuaded him to take nourishment.
sentences.cn: 我什么时候也忘不了他劝说他增加营养的那种耐心和手腕.

sentences.en: It's not tactful to do so.
Melanie, the most tactful of women, had tears in her eyes at her own cruelty.
sentences.cn: 媚兰为人很敏感, 她觉得自己不该惹思嘉伤心,因此十分内疚, 急得又要哭了.

sentences.en: Remember to be tactful when expressing a personal judgement.
sentences.cn: 记住表达个人看法要婉转.

sentences.en: She gets them to accept these changes by tactful management.
sentences.cn: 她用圆滑的手腕说服他们接受这些变动.

sentences.en: That wasn't a very tactful thing to say!
There was no tactful way of phrasing what he wanted to say.
sentences.cn: 没有办法婉转地表达他想说的话。

sentences.en: What he said was not very tactful.

words.tran_cn: 不机智的；不老练的；笨拙的
不机智地；不得体地；不圆滑地

trans.tran_cn: 机智的，机敏的，得体的，老练的，圆滑的，婉转的
trans.tran_en: not likely to upset or embarrass other people
